frameDefinitions: In this frame either a Stimulus brings about a particular emotion or experience in the Experiencer or  saliently fails to bring about a particular experience.
An Employer employs an Employee whose Position entails that the Employee perform certain Tasks in exchange for Compensation.
This frame contains  words for Individuals as viewed in terms of their vocation.
The words in this frame describe motion involving a Vehicle and someone who controls it, the Driver.
A Defendant is tried by a Jury or Judge in a Court for Charges.
Geography as defined by its use.
frameExamples: I <t>employed</t> him as Chief Gardener for ten years.
Tim <t>drove</t> his car all the way across North America.
The state will <t>try</t> him for fraud.
You must land in the next <t><fex name='Locale'>airfield</fex></t>, as this one is currently having difficulties.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the object or event which brings about the emotion in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The role <fen>Employee</fen> denotes the person who is obligated to perform some <fen>Task</fen> in order to receive <fen>Compensation</fen>.
The <fen>Employer</fen> is the person (or institution) that gives <fen>Compensation</fen> to an <fen>Employee</fen>.
The role <fen>Field</fen> identifies the field in which the <fen>Employee</fen> is employed.
The role <fen>Position</fen> indicates a particular type of employment.
The <fen>Task</fen> indicates the action/duty that the <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to do for the <fen>Employer</fen>.
The role <fen>Time</fen> identifies the time at whcih the <fen>Employer</fen> hires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
The role <fen>Place</fen> identifies the location where the <fen>Employer</fen> hires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
The <fen>Person</fen> is the human being.
This is the being, typically human, that controls the <fen>Vehicle</fen> as it moves.
This is the means of conveyance controlled by the <fen>Driver</fen>.  It may move in any way or medium.  With verbs, <fen>Vehicle</fen> is usually expressed as Object:

Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion.  With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.

Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen> expresses the frame element <fen>Path</fen>. This includes directional expressions and 'middle of path'' expressions, e.g.:

Any expression which tells where the moving object(s) ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element <fen>Goal</fen>. Some particles imply the existence of a <fen>Goal</fen> which is understood in the context of utterance.

This frame element is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path. Locative setting adjuncts of motion expressions may also be assigned this frame element.
The  <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Driver</fen> operates the <fen>Vehicle</fen>
The <fen>Place</fen> describes the location of a more specific motion (which has <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>).
The <fen>Judge</fen> heads the <fen>Court</fen> where the case is tried.  An expression referring to the <fen>Court</fen> may also stand in for the <fen>Judge</fen>.
The <fen>Defendant</fen> is being tried for the <fen>Charges</fen> in <fen>Court</fen>.

This role identifies the people who are charged by the <fen>Court</fen> to listen to the testimony, evidence, and arguments, and come to a consensus about the guilt or innocence of the <fen>Defendant</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Charges</fen> brought against the <fen>Defendant</fen>.
The <fen>Defendant</fen> is tried under the laws of the <fen>Governing_authority</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the case is tried.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the case is tried.
A stable bounded area.  It is typically the designation of the nouns of Locale-derived frames.
The activity that is carried out in the <fen>Locale</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>I</fex> was employed by an international corporation.
<fex>I</fex> employed him as Chief Gardener for ten years.
He was employed<fex>in finance</fex> fourteen years ago.
I am employed <fex>to collect the trash</fex>.
Charles has been an employee of Microsoft <fex>since 1998</fex>!
Actually, he employed me <fex> at the downtown office </fex>.
The bikers rode <fex>all over the place</fex>.
<fex>Yesterday</fex>, Smithers paddled his boat across the lake and back
<fex>Judge Murphy</fex> will try the defendant for murder.
<fex>The United States</fex> will try the accused bomber in a federal courthouse.
There used to be a carnival every summer in that <fex><t>city</t></fex>.
The Campus <fex>Microscopy and Imaging</fex> Facility (CMIF) serves a wide range of faculty staff and students of The Ohio State University .

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Division of Substance Abuse and Mental Health
